revision.text:
'''Mofungo''' was a [[New York City]] based band that was active from 1979-1993.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ny.eater.com/archives/2013/06/sietsemas_fond_farewell_to_nightlife_legend_maxwells.php |title=Sietsema's Fond Farewell to Nightlife Legend Maxwell's - Sietsema - Eater NY |publisher=Ny.eater.com |date=2013-06-06 |accessdate=2013-07-08}}</ref> It featured guitarist [[Elliott Sharp]] and future food blogger [[Robert Sietsema]]. [[Robert Christgau]] described their last album as "basically unlistenable unless you grant it your full attention".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.robertchristgau.com/get_artist.php?name=Mofungo |title=CG: Mofungo |publisher=Robert Christgau |date= |accessdate=2013-07-08}}</ref> The [[New York Times]] described them as "not your typical rock and roll band".<ref>{{cite web|author=ROBERT PALMERPublished: April 03, 1987 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1987/04/03/arts/pop-jazz-raucous-rockers-add-a-message.html |title=Pop/Jazz; Raucous Rockers Add A Message - New York Times |publisher=Nytimes.com |date=1987-04-03 |accessdate=2013-07-08}}</ref>
==Discography== *End of the World [(unlabeled), 1981] *Out of Line [Zoar, 1983] *Frederick Douglass [Twin/Tone/Coyote, 1985] *Messenger Dogs of the Gods [Lost, 1986] *End of the World, Part 2 [Lost, 1987] *Bugged [SST, 1988] *Work [SST, 1989]
